text: Wow that's basically what I have to do for my final project funny enough, I have recorded footage of a street and greenscreened my pet cat and I'm gonna make it like a giant cat causing destruction, most of the VFX would be making buildings look damaged and blending that to make it look realistic to sell the shot, not my original plan but I was told that was recommended to do to make it blend in well that when someone watches they wouldn't even notice the fake buildings or something and speaking of development of the eye, how have you managed? Do you have a method that you may have discovered to get that "eye"? I can only think about paying more attention and consideration to how things look as a way to develop the eye to figure out the factors that sell the shot, paying attention to little details

I was always interested in the things that were hidden in plain sight, it was actually going to be one of my original essay titles for one of my assignments so its quite cool how you work at invisible VFX, something I'm also interested in
